item.title: Bulletin updated at 17:02 HKT 05/07/2021
item.description:
At 5 p.m. at the Hong Kong Observatory :
Air temperature : 33 degrees Celsius
Relative Humidity : 69 per cent
During the past hour the mean UV Index recorded at King's Park : 3
Intensity of UV radiation : moderate

The tropical depression now situated to the northeast of Luzon is moving across the Luzon Strait and will track in the general direction of the eastern coast of Guangdong tomorrow (6 July). Its circulation is relatively small. It will bring squally showers mainly to the southeastern part of China. On the other hand, the area of low pressure over the central part of the South China Sea will develop and move towards the vicinity of Hainan Island tomorrow, bringing unsettled weather to the coast of Guangdong. Depending on the developments of these two systems, the Observatory will consider issuing the Standby Signal, No. 1 tomorrow morning. Members of the public are advised to take note of the latest weather bulletin before departing tomorrow morning.

Please be reminded that:
The Very Hot Weather Warning is now in force. The public should beware of heatstroke and drink more water.
